text: Discussion
This study defines the oncogenic properties of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in promoting B cell lymphomagenesis .

<extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic mice have a higher incidence of lymphoma [ 26 ] and the progression to lymphoma correlates with higher expression levels of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( Figure 1A and 1B ) , suggesting that <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is directly involved in tumor development .

text: Table 1 summarizes the biological and molecular properties that were identified in wild-type and <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic lymphomas .

Although many of the molecular properties studied were similar between wild-type and <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic lymphomas , there were distinguishing biological properties , namely the ability of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic lymphomas to induce higher levels of survival and proliferation .

Interestingly , although <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic mice develop lymphomas in the same B-1a cell type as spontaneous wild-type lymphomas ( Figure 2 ) , some signaling effects induced by <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may explain the enhanced promotion to lymphomagenesis .

Since <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - deficient mice have decreased numbers of IgMhighIgDlow cells , a phenotype associated with B-1 , marginal zone , and memory B cells , the mimicry of <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling by <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> could possibly contribute to the expansion of B-1 cells [ 20 ] .

It is noteworthy that expression of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in transgenic mice has been shown to inhibit the formation of GCs [ 23 , 49 ] , preventing typical B-2 cells from antigen - driven selection and expansion .
The lack of GC reactions may contribute to the bias of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic mice towards B-1 cell lymphomas .
Interestingly , <extra_id_0> LMP2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling also favors development of B-1 cells , but this occurs in the absence of transformation .
These results suggest that the mimicry of B cell receptor signaling by <extra_id_0> LMP2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promotes B-1 cell differentiation but not transformation [ 24 , 50 , 51 ] .
This promotion of B-1 differentiation may account for the ability of <extra_id_0> LMP2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to exacerbate autoimmunity and bypass anergy induction [ 52 , 53 ] .

In contrast , the preponderance of tumors of B-1a origin does not reflect effects of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling on B cell differentiation , as splenic B cells from healthy <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic mice contain similar numbers of B-1 and B-2 cells as wild-type mice .
In support of this lack of effect , the differentiation of B-1 versus B-2 cells is thought to be independent of <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling [ 54 ] .
B-1 cells constitute the predominant lymphocyte population in the peritoneal and pleuropericardial cavities , while B-2 cells are mainly found in the spleen , lymph node , and peripheral blood .
B-1 cells produce the main source of IgM and IgA antibodies in serum , which are involved in T cell - independent responses to common microbial antigens .
Importantly , B-1 cells have the unique capacity to self replenish and are also predisposed to transformation [ 28 , 29 ] .
Clonal expansion of B-1 cells can be detected in aging mice above 18 mo of age , and B-1 cells are thought to be the murine progenitor of B cell chronic lymphocytic leukemia [ 30 ] .

The data presented in this study indicate that although <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is expressed in all B lymphocytes in the transgenic mice , malignancy develops in this specific subset of B cells .
The elevated expression of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in B-1a cells and the activation of specific pathways apparently induce malignant growth .

text: These same pathways can also become sporadically activated in aged mice and also result in lymphoma development .

This is similar to EBV - associated cancers in vivo , where pathways that are activated by <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are also activated in the less prevalent EBV - negative forms of the cancers [ 40 , 55-58 ] .

Thus , the contribution of EBV and <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to tumor development is apparently the continuous activation of pathways that can also be sporadically activated and contribute to tumor development .

The lymphomas were marked by the upregulation of <extra_id_0> IL10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , constitutive activation of <extra_id_0> Stat3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling , and a requirement for activation of <extra_id_0> Akt <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , NFkappaB , and <extra_id_0> Stat3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> pathways ( Figures 5 and 7 ) .

Induction of <extra_id_0> IL10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is associated with the transformation of B-1 lymphomas in mice [ 59 , 60 ] and is frequently associated with EBV - positive B cell malignancies acting as a B cell growth factor [ 35-38 ] .

In addition , <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has been shown to stimulate <extra_id_0> IL10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in Burkitt lymphoma cell lines [ 61 , 62 ] .

text: <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activates both the canonical and non-canonical pathways of NFkappaB signaling [ 14 , 63-65 ] , and inhibition of NFkappaB blocked the survival of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic lymphocytes and <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - positive and - negative lymphoma cells .

NFkappaB and PI3K signaling are crucial for <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced proliferation , and mice deficient for <extra_id_0> cRel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or the <extra_id_0> p85 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> regulatory subunit of PI3K are unresponsive to mitogenic stimuli , including <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ligation [ 66-68 ] .

text: Although <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has been shown to deregulate the <extra_id_0> Rb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> pathway in epithelial cells [ 69 ] , to our knowledge this is the first demonstration of this property in B lymphocytes .

The requirement for <extra_id_0> Akt <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activation was confirmed by the striking inhibition of lymphoma viability by triciribine , an <extra_id_0> Akt <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibitor .

text: This effect has also been described in EBV - positive HD biopsies [ 40 ] .

In contrast , rapamycin , U0126 , and SB202190 did not affect the survival of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic lymphocytes or the wild-type and <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic lymphoma cells ( Figure 7A , 7C , and 7E ) .
This lack of effect by rapamycin confirmed the absence of activated <extra_id_0> p-mTOR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels ( Figure 6B ) .

text: These findings suggest that other <extra_id_0> Akt <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> targets contribute to malignant progression .
One key target is likely the inhibition of the <extra_id_0> Fox01 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription factors .

Repression of the pro-apoptotic transcription factor <extra_id_0> FoxO1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in a PI3K - dependent manner can inhibit expression of <extra_id_0> bcl6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a transcription factor necessary for GC formation [ 49 , 70 ] .

text: It has been shown that overstimulation of <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling with agonistic antibodies inhibits GC formation [ 71 ] .

Similarly , due to mimicry of <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling , transgenic <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mice are also defective in GC formation [ 23 , 49 ] .
The constitutive signaling by <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> likely blocks GC formation through downregulation of <extra_id_0> bcl6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Interestingly , clinical studies indicate that expression of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> bcl6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are mutually exclusive in non-HD and classical HD [ 72 , 73 ] .

text: Thus , the <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic lymphomas mirror aspects of EBV - induced HD .

Although the activation of <extra_id_0> Akt <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the lack of <extra_id_0> Fox01 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the lymphoma cells suggest that <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> affects <extra_id_0> bcl6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and GC formation through this pathway , regulation of other Forkhead targets involved in cell cycle progression , such as <extra_id_0> p27 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CyclinD2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , likely contribute to malignant transformation .

text: Indeed , loss of <extra_id_0> FoxO1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in lymphoma cells correlated with a loss of <extra_id_0> p27 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( Figure 6B and 6C ) .

text: <extra_id_0> CyclinD2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has also been shown to be upregulated by <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> through release of <extra_id_0> FoxO1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated repression [ 70 ] .

In summary , in this transgenic model of lymphomagenesis , <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promotes malignancy in B-1a cells , a population that is predisposed to clonal expansion with age .

The malignant lymphocytes were distinguished by constitutively active <extra_id_0> Stat3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling , decreased <extra_id_0> p27 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and activated <extra_id_0> Akt <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and NFkappaB pathways , properties that are associated with promoting the growth and survival of B lymphocytes .

Importantly , <extra_id_0> Akt <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , NFkappaB , and <extra_id_0> Stat3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> pathways were critically required for the growth and survival of malignant lymphocytes as well as healthy <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic lymphocytes .

The growth of EBV-transformed lymphocytes also requires activation of NFkappaB , and these studies provide insight into how <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> contributes to EBV - associated transformation .

The transgenic lymphomas mirror multiple aspects of EBV - induced tumors and suggest that in vivo these properties of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are major factors in the development of cancer .
